column2: SESSION 1 TRAINING
FIRST HALF OF THE WEEK - BRIEF SCENARIO TRAINING
TOPIC CONGRUENT - 10 SCENARIOS FOR EACH DOMAIN
Note: 1 scenario has to have a negative ending, 2 scenarios have to have a resilience ending
ACADEMICS
Scenario
column3: Second part (resilience)
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: Your caregiver wants you to go to a specific college. You would rather go to a different college but your caregiver has made it clear they are not on board with the school choice. When you think about talking with your caregiver about your choice, you feel
column7: Can you handle talking to your caregiver about your college choice?

column2: You have a test in your history class today. You've been studying hard for it because it counts for a big chunk of your final grade. When the teacher places the test on your desk and you look at the first question, you feel
column7: Do you feel ready for your test today?

column2: You just turned in an important paper. As you're checking your submission, you see a typo in the first sentence. You believe that you should be
column7: Should you be worried about the typo?

column2: You are taking your SATs tomorrow. You know that the score you need to get into the college of your dreams is high. As you think about the test, you know that you are
column7: Are you prepared for the SAT?

column2: Your teacher asks a question to the class in your virtual classroom. You click the "raise hand" button and prepare your response. You think that you'll sound
column3: You get called on and say your answer. Your friends probably thought you sounded
column7: Did the other students think you sounded dumb?

column2: You'd like to go to technical school after graduation. Your family expects you to get into a challenging four-year college, and you don't want to let them down. When considering your plans for after graduation, you feel
column7: Are you anxious about your plans for after graduation?

column2: In gym class today, you have to run a mile. In order to get a good grade, you have to complete the mile within 13 minutes. When you think about running the mile, you feel
column7: Are you able to complete the mile in gym class today?

column2: Your teacher catches you texting during class and takes your phone away. You don't like when people are mad at you, but you know that your teacher will say something to you at the end of class. For the rest of class, you feel
column3: When class ends, your teacher gives your phone back and reminds you to not have it out during class. You think your teacher is being
column7: Was your teacher mean about taking your phone away?

column2: Your teacher calls on you to answer a question about the book you just read. You don't know what to say, and your mind goes blank. After a few moments, you prepare your answer and feel
column7: Are you able to answer the question?

column2: You are sitting in your online classroom and space out for a minute. Your teacher calls on you to answer a question and you didn't hear it. You ask her to repeat her question and this makes you feel
column7: Are you comfortable asking your teacher to repeat her question?

column2: Great job with those scenarios in your domain! Now you'll get to practice a few more scenarios that are from other domains. This will help you apply your flexible thinking skills to lots of different types of situations!
You have a lot of homework due tomorrow. You've been procrastinating getting it done because it is going to be hard. When you think doing your homework tonight, you are
column7: Are you going to complete your homework?

column2: You are on a field trip with your school to a local museum and have a group assignment to complete while you're there. You've been grouped with other students who usually don't care about getting a good grade. You start to think about how the assignment will go, and feel
column7: Are you worried about completing the assignment?

column2: Your friend is having a get together tonight. You weren't invited, but most of your other friends were. When you think about it, you realize it's because you are
column7: Were you not invited because you were busy?

column2: You live with a few extended family members. Your friend asks if they can come over after school to study, and they don't know how many people live in your home. As you picture your friend coming into your home, you think they will be
column3: You consider that you live in a different situation compared to your friend. You also know that your friend is really nice, so will be
column7: Does your friend judge you for living with lots of extended family members?

column2: You are talking to your parent about your day at school and suddenly you feel your throat go dry. You cough a little and reach for a glass of water. The water helps a little, and you realize that the dry through was probably
column7: Does the dry throat mean that you are sick?

column2: SOCIAL SITUATIONS

column7: Comprehension Question

column2: You notice your smaller home is not as spacious as the homes of others that you know. Your best friend has never been to your place, but wants to come over and spend the night. You think about their reaction to your home and they will be
column7: Will your friends judge your home?

column2: You are working at the grocery store bagging groceries and notice two friends who you have not seen in a while. They are buying drinks and snacks, and they say hi as they're checking out. They probably think that you are
column7: Are your friends judging you for working?

column2: You are hanging out with some friends. One of them invites another one to come over to their house on a different day without you. You think about it and realize you feel
column7: Are you upset that you weren't invited, too?

column2: You are talking with a group of friends about TV shows. When you say what you like about an old TV show that you just discovered, no one responds. They probably think that you are
column7: Do your friends judge you for what you said about the TV show?

column2: It's a warm day and you and your friends are taking a walk outside. You notice that you are starting to sweat, and you can see some marks on your shirt. You know these friends well, and they will not
column7: Will your friends make fun of your sweat marks on your shirt?

column2: You're at the thrift store with your parent and you're looking through the clothes. You notice two people from your school in the other part of the store laughing. They are probably laughing at a
column7: Are the other students from your school laughing at you?

column2: You're in a big group of your friends. Everyone is telling stories but you haven't said anything the whole conversation. Your friends probably think you're
column3: While listening to your friends, you remember that your friend was quiet the other day. You decide that not always sharing is
column7: Is it normal to not share all of the time?

column2: You are going on a date tonight. You don't know the person well and you know there will be some silences in the conversation. Even though it might be awkward, you know you'll have
column7: Are you able to cope with awkward silences?

column2: You're talking to a group of your friends at lunch. You make a joke that you think is really funny, but no one really laughs. They were probably
column7: Did you say the wrong thing?

column2: Your friend is having a get together tonight. You weren't invited, but most of your other friends were. When you think about it, this makes you feel
column3: You realize you told your friends you had a lot of homework to do. This makes you feel
column7: Were you not invited because you were busy?

column2: PHYSICAL HEALTH
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You are lying in your bed and about to go to sleep. You start to feel a heaviness in your chest as you try to sleep. You think about this pressure and feel
column7: Are you worried about the heaviness in your chest as you fall asleep?

column2: You are walking to an important meeting with your teacher. Suddenly your mind goes blank as you reach for the doorknob to her office. You think about your mind going blank and think that this is
column7: Is it scary that your mind went blank right before your meeting?

column2: It's a chilly spring day, and you are out walking outside in the park, hitting the soccer ball around. As you pass by the trees, you feel increasingly stuffy and sore. You start feeling
column3: Looking around, you see all the pollen flying in the air. You realize that you usually get a stuffy nose with seasonal allergies and are probably tired from playing soccer for the last hour. You feel
column7: Does your rapid heartrate mean something bad is happening?

column2: You decide to spin yourself really quickly on an office chair. You feel butterflies in your stomach and your head get dizzy as the chair slows down from spinning. These feelings probably mean that you are
column7: Are you worried about feeling dizzy?

column2: As you wake up in the morning, you sit up quickly. Your vision goes blurry, and then goes black for a moment. Your vision comes back after a moment, and you tell yourself that it happened because you sat up
column7: Does your momentary blurry vision mean that you are going blind?

column2: You are at a birthday party for a friend of a friend. You start to feel a knot in your stomach while talking to someone you've never met before. This probably means that you are
column7: Are you worried about talking to a new person?

column2: You are taking a dancing class and, during a break, feel your legs go wobbly. You focus on these feelings as you get a drink of water. Wobbly legs probably mean that you are pushing
column7: Are your wobbly legs a sign that you are unwell?

column2: It's a cold day, and you are outside jogging. Your heart starts to beat quickly a few minutes in. You decide that this feeling is
column7: Is your rapid heartbeat scary?

column2: You are about to audition for a play and you feel your body tremble. You don't usually feel this way when you perform in front of people. These trembling feelings mean that you are
column7: Do the trembling feelings mean that you are unprepared for the audition?

column2: You are giving a presentation in school that you have been really nervous to give. As you talk, you feel a lump in your throat and you start to cough. These feelings probably mean that you are
column3: You decide to take a slow, deep breath. As you start to talk again, you realize that what you felt was
column7: Is it normal to cough during a presentation?

column2: SOCIAL MEDIA
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You and your friend took some pictures together. You look through your feed and see that they tagged you in a post and you really don't like how you look. But, you know that in the long run it won't
column7: Are you worried about your appearence in the posted picture?

column2: You notice that everyone is posting the same type of posts. You consider posting something totally unique. The thought of doing something different makes you feel
column3: You decide to post something different from what everyone else is doing. After posting, you feel
column7: Do you let your anxiety hold you back from posting something different from everyone else?

column2: You post a short video. Your best friend comments something really embarassing. Your followers will think that you and your friend are
column7: Do others judge you for your friend's comment on your post?

column2: You take a picture of your friend that is really great. You are about to post it but remember that you just posted yesterday. If you post again, you think people won't
column7: Do your followers think it's strange that you posted two days in a row?

column2: You have a lot of followers on social media. Your photo has only a few likes after a few hours, and usually by now you'd have a lot more reactions. You wonder if people aren't liking your post because they are
column7: Are people not reacting to your post because they think you look bad?

column2: You see from social media stories that a group of your friends are hanging out together. You weren't invited and it looks like they're having a great time. Your friends probably didn't invite you because they
column3: You are sad that you weren't invited to hang out with your friends. You realize being sad about the situation is
column7: Did your friends exclude you on purpose?

column2: A new dance is trending on social media. You and your best friend really want to make it, but it requires three people. You decide not to make the video since you do not have a third friend to make it with, and you feel
column7: Are you upset about not having a friend group of three people?
column10: other *idk about this one... may need to be revisted

column2: Your crush asks you about your social media accounts. You don't like social media, and have chosen not to have any accounts. Your crush will think that you are
column7: Does your crush think it's fine that you don't have social media?

column2: You meet a new student in biology who seems really cool. After school, they request to follow you on your private social media account. Before you let them follow you, you look over your own feed and feel
column7: Are you worried about what your classmate thinks of your profile?

column2: You can see that friend opened the photo you sent but didn't respond to you. You know that they're posting other things, so they're definitely on their phone. Your friend probably didn't respond because they
column7: Is your friend ignoring you on purpose?

column2: HOME LIFE
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: You notice your parents are upset but you don't know what's wrong. They give you a short answer when you try to talk with them at dinner. You consider why they're mad, and realize that it is not
column7: Are they upset with you?

column2: Your family shares one older car that has a big dent in the front. Today your parent has to drop you off at school because you are running a little late. When you think about your classmates seeing your parent's car, you feel
column3: As you're getting out of the car in front of the school, you see your group of friends. They smile and wave at you, and you feel
column7: Do your friends judge your parent's car?

column2: Your friend is having a huge birthday party with all of your friends attending. You know you can't afford a gift for your friend. You show up with a homemade card, your friend is
column7: Is your friend sad you did not bring a present?

column2: Your guardian is dropping you off at your sports practice. As they drop you off, they are really loud and make you feel embarrassed. As you get out of the car, you feel
column7: Are you able to tolerate your guardian embarrassing you while being dropped off?

column2: At home there are a lot of chores that your parents said you have to finish today. You have a big project to work on that will take a lot of time. Balancing your home life and school life is
column3: You look for a good artist to listen to while you do your chores. As you start to tackle your to-do list, you feel
column7: Are you overwhelmed by what you need to accomplish?

column2: You invite your friend over after school and your parents are home. Your parents are pretty opinionated and may say something embarrassing to your friend. As you and your friend walk into your home, you are
column7: Are you anxious as you and your friend go into your home?

column2: You and some friends are watching a movie at your home. At the end of the movie, your friend asks what that funny smell is. You know that's your dinner, and when you think about how to answer you feel
column7: Are you anxious about telling your friend that the smell is your dinner?

column2: You have recieved a poor score on a test and your guardian has to sign off on it since the grade is low. They don't say anything when you show them your test. They are probably feeling
column7: Is your guardian disappointed that you got a bad grade?

column2: Your friends ask you to go to a concert, but it's the night of an important cultural celebration for your family. You are looking forward to the celebration with your family, but don't want your friends to think you're lame. As you think about telling your friends, you realize that your culture is
column7: Are you embarrassed to tell your friends that you can't go to the concert?

column2: You want to go to college, no one in your family has gone to college yet. You think about how your family will react when you tell them your decision and they may not like the idea of you going to college. As you imagine telling them, you feel
column7: Are you worried about telling your family that you want to go to college?

column2: GENERAL
Scenario
column7: Comprehension Question
column9: Type of ending (positive, negative, or resilence)

column2: At a picnic with family, you accidentally cut your finger while slicing fruit. Because you are outside, you are not able to wash it out immediately with soap and water. In a few days, your cut will be
column7: Are you worried the cut will become infected?

column2: You get a text from a friend that they are in the hospital, but they don't tell you why. You start to worry about whether they're going to be OK. As you think about your friend, you feel
column7: Will your friend probably be OK?

column2: You are babysitting a younger kid in your neighborhood and they just went to sleep. It's dark out and you suddenly hear noises outside. You peek out the window and see a
column7: Was there something scary outside in the dark?

column2: You are at a water park with a group of friends and everyone you're with wants to go on the tallest slide. As you climb the stairs, you look over the side and feel your stomach drop. You think that this ride will be
column3: You reach the top of the stairs and your friends go down the slide. Even though you're anxious, you go down the slide and
column7: Were you able to overcome your anxiety and enjoy the tall slide?

column2: Your friend convinces you to go on a walk through a local park. You have heard that there are poisonous snakes in that park and start to feel worried. You think that the chances that you will see that kind of snake are
column7: Are you likely to get bitten by a poisonous snake?

column2: You and your family are heading out of town for a few days. Your mom asks you to double-check that all the appliances in your house are turned off. As you close the door to your house, you feel
column7: Are you worried about whether you turned off everything in the house?

column2: You are auditioning for a play. You say most of your lines correctly but mess up on one or two. You think the audition went
column7: Do you feel good about the audition?

column2: You're going on a long car ride with your family to visit family in another part of the state. After an hour, you notice your phone battery is almost dead and you don't have a charger. You think about the rest of the car ride and feel like you will be
column3: After worrying about it for a few minutes, you realize that you can use this time to talk to your family. You feel
column7: Will the car ride be ok without your phone?

column2: You are on your way home after a soccer game that your team won. As your mind wanders, you think about the one goal that you missed. Overall, you consider your performance a
column7: Reflecting on the soccer game, do you think you played well?

column2: You are bringing in the mail for your neighbors while they are away. On your way out of their house each day, you lock the front door and check the lock. Today you were rushing and think you forgot to check the lock, and you think the house will probably be
column7: Will your neighbor’s house probably be robbed?
